titleStmt.title: Description of Bryn Mawr College Libraries BV 53: Devotional book.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Special Collections BV 53: Devotional book. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Bryn Mawr College, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Special Collections BV 53: Devotional book.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

note: A letter dated November 1, 1923 to Edwin Wolf from Cyrus Adler of the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning describing the manuscript is laid in.

msContents.summary: Devotional book containing selections from the Qurʼān, several illuminated seals (muhr) and calligraphic drawings with the names of God, the Prophet Muḥammad, other Imams and family members; three blank pages at the end have been prepared for drawing but left unfilled (f. 69v-70v).

supportDesc.extent: 70 foliated leaves : 175 x 120 (108 x 54) mm bound to 175 x 127 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed, vocalized.

decoNote: All pages have gold, foliate marginal fill; textblock is border-ruled in a wide gold band with a repeating geometric pattern in black and a narrow, red outside rule. Illuminated headpiece in gold with red, blue, and green on first opening (f. 1v); all section titles are in white ink on a gold background outlined in a colored box. Polychrome floral medallions in the margins and gold, lobed circles with orange and blue dots mark verse endings. 16 pages of illuminations and illustrations (f. 61v-69r).

decoNote.#text: Illuminated panel: Rasm Abū Bakr al-Ṣadīq

binding.p: Bound in paper with large, gilded flower and frame; remnants of a red spine.

origin.p: Copied in 1158 A.H. (1771 or 1772 C.E.) by Muṣṭafá al-maʻrūf bi-Kūtāhī (f. 60r).

history.provenance: Gift of Blanche Wolf Kohn, Bryn Mawr College 1908, on 2 June 1958.
